task.title: Creating an Android widget project
task.shortdesc: The New Android Widget Project wizard allows you to quickly and easily create a new widget application for an Android device.

step.cmd: Select FileNewAndroid Widget Project using Studio for Android.
step.stepresult: The New Android Widget Project dialog appears with a number of default values filled in.

step.cmd: Specify a name for your new project in Project name.
If you want your project stored in a subdirectory (named with the project name) within default location (usually the workspace root) leave Use default location selected. Otherwise:

substep.cmd: Use the Location field to specify the directory in which the project subdirectory should be created.

step.cmd: Verify that the SDK target is correct for your widget application.
Using the Application name field, supply the name that should identify your widget in the widgets list accessible from the Android home screen.

Verify the Package name, Activity name, and Min SDK version fields. All are set to reasonable defaults by the new Android Widget Project wizard, but all can be changed if needed for your particular application.

taskbody.result: You project is now created and added to those listed in the Project Explorer view.
